Followup: MachineOwner

Reproducible: Always

Steps to Reproduce:
Install Firefox on Citrix Terminal Server, Publish Application
Firefox consumes a lot of memory and sometimes crashes

Actual Results:  
Install Firefox with /change user install
Publish Firefox
Load occours

Expected Results:  
stability

I'm afraid this isn't all that useful without more details of what you were doing. I urge you to install a build with the quality reporting tool (do a Custom install and choose it) and report crashes through that mechanism -- it catches a lot more usable detail.

see the user support groups listed at http://www.mozilla.org/support/ for more information.
comments.text:
I'm afraid this isn't all that useful without more details of what you were doing. I urge you to install a build with the quality reporting tool (do a Custom install and choose it) and report crashes through that mechanism -- it catches a lot more usable detail.

see the user support groups listed at http://www.mozilla.org/support/ for more information.
comments.creator: dveditz@mozilla.com
comments.author: dveditz@mozilla.com
timeless@bemail.org
comments.raw_text:
you can't debug stripped builds, all you'll get are offsets from exported symbols which won't help anyone. if you want to use windbg to do debugging, then you'll need to find or build a build that has symbols, either --enable-debug or --enable-debugger-info-modules.

see:
http://developer.mozilla.org/en/docs/How_to_get_a_stacktrace_with_WinDbg
it has a link to a build and explains how to use windbg to get useful information from it.

comments.creator: timeless@bemail.org

comments.raw_text:
I'm not sure if i understand your report: are you trying to make Firefox accessible through Citrix, or are you running the Citrix plugin in Firefox?

Fwiw, a regular firefox trunk build with the Citrix client installed wfm on Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; U; PPC Mac OS X Mach-O; en-US; rv:1.9a1) Gecko/20060403 Firefox/1.6a1
comments.text:
I'm not sure if i understand your report: are you trying to make Firefox accessible through Citrix, or are you running the Citrix plugin in Firefox?

Fwiw, a regular firefox trunk build with the Citrix client installed wfm on Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; U; PPC Mac OS X Mach-O; en-US; rv:1.9a1) Gecko/20060403 Firefox/1.6a1
comments.creator: patrick.hendriks+bugzilla@gmail.com
comments.author: patrick.hendriks+bugzilla@gmail.com

comments.creator: houser@hush.com
comments.text:
We published Firefox as default browser on the TS

It may be not possible to install a debug/checked build on the TS, since Applications are published with NetInstall Citrix Addon.

We can´t see what users are doing, we only can see crashes in firefox.
comments.raw_text:
We published Firefox as default browser on the TS

It may be not possible to install a debug/checked build on the TS, since Applications are published with NetInstall Citrix Addon.

We can´t see what users are doing, we only can see crashes in firefox.
comments.author: houser@hush.com
timeless@bemail.org
comments.text:
can you configure the ts to save full application dumps (.dmp) as described om that url?

as to your packaging mess. firefox doesn't offer msi's to begin w/. just take the archived firefox from the url and drop it into place. firefox doesn't require the registry or anything to get work done, so as long as you can write to the directory that has your programs, you'll be fine.
comments.creator: timeless@bemail.org
comments.raw_text:
can you configure the ts to save full application dumps (.dmp) as described om that url?

as to your packaging mess. firefox doesn't offer msi's to begin w/. just take the archived firefox from the url and drop it into place. firefox doesn't require the registry or anything to get work done, so as long as you can write to the directory that has your programs, you'll be fine.

comments.author: cbook@mozilla.com
comments.text:
-> closing as incomplete, because of missing Feedback.

Helmut, if you still crash with Firefox 2.0.0.4, please see the comment #5
